channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Justice Merchan, Judge in Trump’s Hush-Money Case, Faces ‘Impossible’ Task
item.description: Justice Juan M. Merchan has tried to treat Donald J. Trump like the hundreds of other defendants whose fates he has decided. But his decision could al...

item.title: Live Updates: Russia Unleashes New Strikes as Ukraine Plans Cabinet Shake-Up
item.description: Several ministers offered to resign in a major reshuffle of Ukraine’s government. While rescuers searched the rubble of a deadly strike on a military ...

item.title: U.S. Market Slump Led by Nvidia Sparks Global Sell-Off
item.description: Another day of anxiety hit stock markets around the world, with technology stocks the focus of attention.

item.title: Russia Strikes Ukraine, Killing 7 in Lviv, Local Authorities Report
item.description: Russia attacked a number of cities a day after a devastating strike in the country’s east, Ukrainian officials said.

item.title: U.S. to Accuse Russia of Using Its State Media to Influence 2024 Election
item.description: American spy agencies have assessed that the Kremlin favors former President Donald J. Trump, seeing him as skeptical of U.S. support for Ukraine.

item.title: Biden’s Asylum Restrictions Were Meant to Be Temporary. Now That Could Change.
item.description: The changes under consideration would build on the executive order that President Biden issued in June, which blocked a vast majority of asylum claims...

item.title: Ukraine Foreign Minister, Dmytro Kuleba, Offers His Resignation, Official Says
item.description: Dmytro Kuleba has lobbied Kyiv’s allies to supply missile defense systems. He was among several Ukrainian ministers who offered to resign on Wednesday...

item.title: With Hopes Frayed in Gaza Cease-Fire Talks, Mediators Plan a New Push
